sen.j: 救小屋（すくいごや）とは、江戸時代、地震や火災、洪水、飢饉などの天災の際に、被害にあった人々を救助するために、江戸幕府や藩などが立てた公的な救済施設（小屋）のことである。
sen.e: Sukuigoya is a public shelter of the Edo Period, built by the Edo shogunate or local feudal domain for victims of earthquakes, fire, famine and other natural disasters.
Sukuigoya is a public shelter of the Edo Period, built by the Edo shogunate or local feudal domain for victims of earthquakes, fire, floods, famine and other natural disasters.
Sukuigoya is a public shelter of the Edo Period, built by the Edo shogunate or local feudal domain for victims of earthquakes, fire, floods, famine and other natural disasters.

sen.j: 御救小屋（おすくいこや）ともいう。
sen.e: It is also known as osukuigoya.
It is also known as osukuigoya.
It is also known as osukuigoya.

sen.j: 地方の諸藩でも盛んに作られたが、地方から逃散した人々などが集まる江戸や大阪などの都市部では、特に大規模な収容施設となった。
sen.e: Although such shelters were also built in various feudal domains, such shelters of exceptionally large scale were built in large cities such as Edo and Osaka, which drew refugees from other parts of the country.

Although such shelters were built in various feudal domains, shelters built in urban area such as Edo and Osaka were exceptionally large in scale, because which should accommodate refugees evaded from other provinces.
sen.cmt: ・変更 （少し読みずらかったので変更しました）also→削除shelters built in large cities such as Edo and Osaka of were exceptionally large in scale, because which should accommodate refugees evaded from other regions.↓shelters built in urban area such as Edo and Osaka were exceptionally large in scale, because which should accommodate refugees evaded from other provinces.
sen.e: Although such shelters were built in various feudal domains, shelters built in urban area such as Edo and Osaka were exceptionally large in scale, because which should accommodate refugees evaded from other provinces.

sen.j: 地方からの都市への流入者の増加は、犯罪の増加に直結することから、江戸市中では治安の維持を目的に町奉行所が管理していた。
sen.e: Since the influx of such people into the cities was linked directly to rise in crime, these shelters were administered by the machi-bugyo (town magistrate) for the purpose of safety and security within the city.

Since the influx of such people from rural region into urban area was linked directly to rise in crime, these shelters were administered by the machi-bugyo (town magistrate) for the purpose of safety and security of the Edo city.
sen.cmt: ・修正such people into the cities→such people from rural region into urban areasafety and security within the city.→safety and security of the Edo city.
sen.e: Since the influx of such people from rural region into urban area was linked directly to rise in crime, these shelters were administered by the machi-bugyo (town magistrate) for the purpose of safety and security of the Edo city.

sen.j: これら施設では宿泊施設のほか、米の支給や職の斡旋を行なわれた。
sen.e: These shelters provided accommodations, as well as supply of rice and assistance in finding work.
